pros:
Supportive management team.
Access to qualifications eg. Level 3/4/5 vocational qualifications.
Wide range of employee benefits.

job_title: Support Worker in Kingston upon Hull, East Riding of Yorkshire, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: People that you look after are great and sometimes some team members can be great
cons:
Long hours
Weekend work
Poor staffing 
Lack of support

review_title: Good for progression but poor management
pros:
Good for progression. Training offered is really good and bespoke to individuals needs.  Good group of stafff around that really do try and make the difference to the people they provide care for.
Above average holiday entitlement for the sector that rises after 5 years.
cons:
Too many layers in management. Top management don’t work care hours on the shop floor and are out of touch with support but make all the changes without consulting those who do the job day in and day out.
Lots of buzz words used but real care and support sometimes gets lost in all the hype surrounding changes to legislation. If as much effort was put into ‘making the difference ‘ compared with the introduction of GDPR then this organisation would be a front runner In the sector.
Illegal working hours. 9 hours between shifts

job_title: Community Support Worker in Northallerton, England
pros: Every one cares and works as a team I work with very experienced people who all want the best for the guys.
cons: None so far as I've only been working for them for 8 months

job_title: Family Support Worker in Scarborough, England
pros:
Easy going company 
Many opportunities to advance in career 
A fun job where no day is the same
cons:
Support from higher management can be unsatisfactory and can lead to staff feeling like they have no support from them, 
Very little compliments given

pros: A caring, responsive company that put the people they support at the centre of everything.  Very supportive to their staff and encourage progression.
cons: I can't think of any cons

job_title: Support Worker in Kingston upon Hull, East Riding of Yorkshire, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros: Great people we supported giving them a voice and maintaining a good quality of life
cons: Too much back biting by staff and Managers alike
